title: Is having access to past exams considered cheating? - Quora

response.answer_text: If those exams are the exact same as the exam you will be taking, that is definitely considered cheating. If they are different, I don’t think it would be considered cheating. I think it would be more of a study guide or materials for studying, but you should check with your school/university to see how legal it is.

Not if you’re doing it as part of your study, no. Many universities even make previous exams available to students so that they can get a sense of how the questions will be structured and so on. If, for whatever reason, you’re not meant to have access to the past exams and you obtain this, then it’s cheating.
